data.title: The Eric Liddell 100 on LinkedIn: #ericliddell100 #sportingexcellence #celebratinggreatness
data.meta_description: The Eric Liddell 100 is extremely honoured to have received a plaque this weekend, to commemorate Eric Liddell and his incredible sporting achievements, 100‚Ä¶
data.text:
HONOURING A LEGEND‚Ä¶ üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å≥Û†Å£Û†Å¥Û†Åøüè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å≥Û†Å£Û†Å¥Û†Åøüè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å≥Û†Å£Û†Å¥Û†Åø So excited and honoured!! On Wednesday night I will be reciting a poem I‚Äôve written commemorating the remarkable achievements of Scottish sports star, Olympic gold medal winner and missionary to China, Eric Liddell- the Flying Scot üè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å≥Û†Å£Û†Å¥Û†Åø At a special event organised by the amazing The Eric Liddell 100 in the Scottish Parliament , in front of invited guests, I will get to honour one of my heroes!!! (Rest assured there will be beaming pictures to follow ) It opens and runs from 25th July to 12th September- if you are in Edinburgh go visit it in the Scottish Parliament #poet #ericliddell #olympics #scottishparliament #motivationalspeaker #legacy #faith #flyingscot #hero #faith #hope #chariotsoffire John MacMillan Wilma McDaniel Lorraine Maginnis Zo√´ Robertson Innes Rattray Shona Stirling Graeme Thompson Alan Cameron Craig Gunn Lesley Robertson Frank Bruno Russell Dalgleish Mike Cassidy Chris McLaughlin Glenn Campbell

What an absolute privilege it was to be able to present Patricia Liddell Russell with an honorary degree yesterday in honour of her father Eric Henry Liddell. We can‚Äôt all be an Eric Liddell, but we can try, and we have choices: ¬∑ We can choose to live in and fight for a world defined not by our differences but by our common hopes. ¬∑ We can choose to help a world defined not by conflict but by peace and opportunity. ¬∑ We can choose as Eric Liddell did to make difference. What Eric Liddell represents is the best of all of us and the promise and invitation of what we could do to help others. He offers us all an example of what is possible. Eric Liddell ‚Äòs values and humanity are as good a foundation as any for striving to make the world a better place. A teacher, a missionary, an athlete, a rugby player, the Flying Scotsman who rose above self- interest to help others. On and off the sports field Eric Henry Liddell made a difference. His life and values invite us all to make a difference. John MacMillan Scottish Athletics The University of Edinburgh University of Toronto Liz Grant Colin HutchisonKim Atkinson Eilidh Doyle Greg McEwan Professor Ian P. Ian Beattie MBE Mark Munro Neil McGillivray Ross Walker Madeleine Orr Sport and Recreation Alliance Sport for Development Coalition Layne Robinson Alison Raw Russell Dalgleish Professor Wendy Alexander Jon Doig Kevin James Lindsay Sarah Krasnoff, PhD David Grevemberg CBE Gilberto Galeazzi Eliza Keogh Stuart Murray Stuart MacDonald FRSA BBC News The Globe and Mail Events John Colquhoun Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office Harvard University James Miller FRSE Kev Dhaliwal OSCAR International The New York Times Professor Sarah Kelly OAM

Today, one hundred years ago, Eric Liddell won the 400m Gold Medal in the Paris Olympics in a world record time. 100 years on, The Eric Liddell Community who I am proud to work for have developed The Eric Liddell 100, which aims to secure, develop and celebrate The Flying Scotsman's legacy. Here a great link from our friends and colleagues at the Museum of World Athletics for your information and interest. To help celebrate Eric's legacy and his Olympic victory, please like, share and list your comments.
